nodes.text: The Valau of Nagoa were an intensely religious tribe of sentients in which Force-sensitives were considered to be marked by the gods, acting as divine instruments of these deities. Valau Force-wielders underwent rituals to shed their former identities and become conduits for their deities' power. The Valau did not believe in the light side or the dark side, only the gods, viewing the Force as an instrument to enforce their unquestionable will.
